template.p:
Dear ,
You receive this email because we would like to be sure that you are the person who changed the document template of company at . If you don't remember doing such action, it means your user credentials might be in the hands of a scammer. When they get user credentials, scammers common schemes are the following:

ul.li: Changing the footer of your document layout to invite your customers to pay invoices on a scam bank account.
Changing the bank account(s) of the company (same purpose).
Changing the bank account(s) for your vendors so you pay your bills on a scam bank account.

template.p: That's why you will receive warning mails like this each time one of those actions is performed. If you think you are victim of a scam:

ul.li: Change your user password (use a strong one). Also check that you don't use the same password for other purposes as well. Those accounts could be compromised as well.

Log in company and have a look on the document layout in the general settings. Check if everything is correct with a particular focus on bank account numbers displayed and make corrections where necessary.
If you had to fix the document layout, then check no sales invoices were sent between and now. Contact your customers if necessary.
